conclusion: Analyze paths created by liquid flow to determine which container it will flow into.
Liquid A flows into the red container (E).
Liquid B (Light Blue) flows down and then right.
Liquid B merges with the path of liquid C.
Liquid B flows into the red container (E).
Liquid C (Blue) flows down and right.
Liquid C merges with liquid B.
Liquid C ends up in the red container (E).
Liquid D (Yellow) flows down and then left.
Liquid D bypasses the red container (E).
Liquid D flows into the cyan container (F).
Container E (Red) receives liquids A, B, and C.
Final Answer: Liquid from A, B, and C flows into container E, while liquid from D flows into container F.
